newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: South American port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: South American port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

ARGENTINA, Sept 10 - Santa Fe - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 20 ft. 6 Ins. at access channel. Diamante - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Max. recommended draft 22 ft. 3 Ins. at passage km 520. San Lorenzo - Five vessels berthed, all loading, of which 1 by-products, 1 soya, 1 maize, 1 sbm, 1 vegetable oil. 2 Vessels in roads. 20 Vessels due at 9 terminals during the coming week. Max. recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. Rosario - Ten vessels berthed of which 3 awaiting orders, 3 discharging fertiliser, 1 loading sbmp, 1 loading fruit, 1 discharging steel products, 1 loading sbo. No vessels in roads, 13 due within the next week. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel.

Villa Constitucion - Two vessels berthed of which 1 discharging iron ore, 1 awaiting orders. None in roads, 2 due Acindar/Puerto Acevedo (iron ore/steel products) guided by Emilio Mitre channel. San Nicolas - Two vessels berthed of which 1 loading wrc, 1 awaiting orders. No vessels in roads, 9 vessels due within the next week. Max. recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. San Pedro - No vessels berthed, none in roads, none due. Recommended draft guided by Emilio Mitre channel. Max. recommded draft for Mitre channel as follows (high tide) 28 ft. 11 ins. Fw.

Buenos Aires - Twenty-three vessels in port, 33 due within the next week. Max. recommended draft 31 ft. Fw. (guided by entrance channel/high tide). Necochea - Five vessels berthed of which 1 discharging dap, 1 loading sfmp, 1 loading wheat, 1 discharging urea, 1 loading maize. 6 Vessels in roads, 5 vessels due within the next week. Max. draft 40 ft. 00 ins. Bahia Blanca - Four vessels berthed of which 2 awaiting orders, 1 loading wheat, 1 loading ethylene. 1 Vessel in roads, 10 vessels due within the next week.

Brazil, Sept 10 - Vitoria - Seven vessels berthed of which 1 wheat discharger, 1 malt discharger, 1 sugar loader, 2 container/general cargo dischargers/loaders, 1 vehicle discharger, 1 container/vehicle discharger. Tubarao - 3 Iron ore loaders. Praia Mole - 2 Steel plate loaders, 1 coal discharger. Portocel - 1 Cellulose loader. Ubu - 1 Iron ore loader, 19 vessels waiting in roads. Santos - Thirty-eight vessels berthed of which 6 full containers, 1 bulk cement discharger, 13 sugar loaders, 4 general cargo, 1 propane discharger, 1 lpg discharger, 1 chemical products discharger, 3 wheat dischargers, 4 fertiliser dischargers, 1 garlic discharger, 1 bulk pellets loader, 1 coal loader, 1 vehicle discharger. 30 Vessels waiting in roads, 110 vessels due over the next 7 days.

Private terminals Cosipa - 1 Steel products loader, 1 iron ore discharger. Itajai - Three vessels berthed of which 1 general cargo, 2 reefers. 4 Vessels waiting in roads, 14 vessels due over the next 7 days. Rio Grande - 12 Berthed of which 2 bulk fertiliser dischargers, 2 full containers, 4 soy loaders, 1 wheat discharger, 1 petroleum discharger, 2 general cargo dischargers. 3 Waiting in roads, 27 due over the next 7 days. Sao Sebastio-Tebar - 2 Vessels berthed commercial quay, no vessels waiting in roads, 12 due over next 7 days. Rio de Janeiro - Nine vessels berthed of which 2 general cargo/ container dischargers, 1 general cargo/steel products loader, 1 salt discharger, 3 wheat dischargers, 1 sugar loader, 1 granite loader.

Tecon - 1 Vessel, 29 due over the next 7 days. Paranagua - 12 Berthed of which 2 pellets loaders, 3 sugar loaders, 1 soy loader, 1 maize loader, 1 frozen goods loader, 1 fertiliser discharger, 1 full container loader/discharger, 1 salt loader/discharger, 1 general cargo loader/discharger. 43 Waiting in roads of which 29 to load (11 sugar, 6 agribulk, 11 pellets, 1 diesel oil), 13 to discharge (12 fertiliser, 1 wheat), 1 container to load/discharge.

CHILE, Sept 9 - Arica - Two vessels in port operating, 5 berths vacant. No vessels waiting in roads, no swell, 13 vessels due during week. Iquique - No vessels operating, 4 berths vacant, 2 berths out of service until 2/10. No vessels in roads, 11 due during week. Antofagasta - Two vessels berthed, 5 berths vacant, 7 vessels due during week to load/discharge concentrates, copper bars, containers, general cargo. No vessels in roads. Valparaiso - Four vessels berthed and operating, 5 berths vacant, 1 out of service. No vessels in roads, 12 due during the week. San Antonio - Five vessels in port operating, 4 berths vacant. 20 Vessels due during week, none waiting in roads. 1 Berth out of service.

Puerto Montt - Two vessels in port, no berths vacant, no vessels in roads, 1 due during week. Punta Arenas - Three vessels/coasters berthed, 2 berths vacant. 7 due during week, none in roads. Conception Bay - Talcahuano - One vessel berthed, no berths vacant, 2 vessels due this week, none in roads. San Vicente - Three vessels berthed and operating, no berths vacant. No vessels in roads, 2 due in week. Navy pier (Molo 500) - 1 Vessel operating, 1 berth vacant. No vessels due this week, none in roads. Steel pier - 1 In port, 1 berth vacant. No vessels due this week, none in roads. Lirquen - Two vessels operating, 4 berths vacant. No vessels in roads, 1 due in week. Oil terminal - 1 tanker operating, 1 berth vacant. No vessels due this week.

PERU, Sept 9 - No strikes at any port. Callao - Seven vessels anchored, 9 general cargo/container vessels berthed. No berthing delays. Paita, Bayovar, Pisco - No vessels berthed, none anchored, no delays. Talara - No vessels anchored, 1 oil tanker berthed, no berthing delays. Chimbote - Two fish meal vessels anchored, no vessels berthed, no berthing delays. Ilo - No vessels anchored, 1 sulphuric acid vessel berthed, no berthing delays.

VENEZUELA, Sept 9 - Puerto Cabello - Three vessels anchored, 7 berthed of which 3 grain, 1 general cargo, 1 ro/ro, 2 bulk cargo. Piers 1 and 2 closed. Guanta - Four vessels anchored, 3 berthed of which 2 grain, 1 containers. Sept 10 - All ports working normally. Orinoco river draft 38 ft. Puerto Ordaz - One vessel loading iron ore, 1 due. Palua - Two vessels due. Boca Grande - One vessel loading iron ore, 1 due. Mile 178 - Five vessels waiting at anchor to load/discharge. Matanzas - Seven vessels operating of which 2 discharging scrap, 4 loading steel products, 1 discharging general cargo, 5 at anchor to load, 3 due. Venalum - Three vessels loading aluminium.

Alcasa - One vessel discharging coke, 1 due. Interalumina - One vessel due. San Felix - One due. Punta Cuchillo - One due. Puerto Cabello - Fourteen vessels operating of which 8 loading/discharging general cargo, 6 discharging grain, 16 due. Maracaibo - Three vessels loading/discharging general cargo. Puerto Miranda - Two loading crude. La Salina - Six vessels loading crude. El Tablazo - Two loading urea. Bajo Grande - Two loading crude. La Ceiba - Two vessels loading coal. Buoy b.71, Palmarejo Sur, Punta Camacho, San Lorenzo - No vessels. Guanta - Four operating of which 1 discharging pipes, 2 discharging grain, 1 loading/discharging general cargo, 1 due. Amuay - Six loading refined products, 6 waiting to load. La Guaira - Two loading/discharging general cargo, 3 due, 3 under repair.
